Posted on behalf of the Boston Vegetarian Society:

 

Hello Boston Vegetarian Society,

In April, Earth Month, we focus on the environment.  We are delighted to have Gene Baur, President and Co-Founder of Farm Sanctuary, share a compelling presentation on this topic!

We will have a large hall at Harvard, so please share this invitation!

Special treat:
We are organizing a Worldwide Vegan Bake Sale table at the event!   Can you contribute some vegan baked goods?     Hit Reply and let us know.  All proceeds will go to Farm Sanctuary.

THURSDAY, APRIL 28, 2011 at 6:30 PM

FREE and open to all.  Gene's book will be available for sale and signing.

"Environmental Impacts of Animal Agriculture"

According to a 2006 U.N. Food and Agriculture Organization report titled "Livestock's Long Shadow," animal agriculture "emerges as one of the top two or three most significant contributors to the most serious environmental problems, at every scale from local to global."    Gene Baur will discuss the impacts of meat, dairy, and egg farming on aspects of the environment including climate change, the Gulf of Mexico "dead zone," use of fossil fuel resources, air and water pollution, and others. He will present evidence from United Nations agencies, mainstream media sources, and Farm Sanctuary's own research. 

Mr Baur will discuss ways for citizens and the agriculture sector to lighten our environmental footprints, and will point the way to a healthier and more compassionate food system. Questions and discussion welcomed.

Gene Baur is President and Co-founder of Farm Sanctuary, the country's leading farm animal advocacy organization.  He has a master’s degree in Agricultural Economics from Cornell University.    He is author of the national best seller "Farm Sanctuary: Changing Hearts and Minds about Animals and Food," which will be available for purchase and signing.   

We are pleased to have Harvard College Vegetarian Society VEGETAS as co-sponsors.

LOCATION:

104 Function Hall
Student Organization Center at Hilles
Harvard University
59 Shepard Street, Cambridge, MA 02138

Red Line T to Harvard Square.  Walk towards Cambridge Common, turn left onto Garden Street, then right on Shepard St.

Hope to see you there!

Evelyn Kimber
Boston Vegetarian Society
www.BostonVeg.org
